comment: Info on 100 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
Info on 100 and 1 000 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.

source: Hajimurat, consultant on Kvankhidatli, A. Zakirova p.c.
comment: Only numerals in range 100—1000 were asked.
example_source: Hajimurat, consultant on Kvankhidatli, asked by A. Zakirova

source: consultant on Muni, A. Zakirova p.c.
comment: No -gu is attested. Only numerals in range 100—1000 were asked.
example_source: consultant on Muni, asked by A. Zakirova

comment: No info on millions.
1 000 000' милйан has no numeral marker (but look at '5 000 000' иншту-гу милйан).
No info on millions.
Tens 50–90 are borrowed and do not have =gu. No info on 100 and higher numerals.
No info on millions.
No info on millions.
example_comment: Root for 'three' is from Upper Gakvari subdialect. The whole root is ɬaɬa, no reduplication.

comment: No info on millions. Tens 30–90 do not have the marker.
Tens 20—90, hundreds 200—900, and, apparently, thousands 2 000—9 000 do not have the marker. No info on millions.
Info on 1 000 is unclear, no info on higher numerals. Unclear whether tens 20–90 have the marker (cf. ‘20’ as k’ˤa:-c’a in [magomedova2012: 145] but k’ˤa:-c’a-ja in [authierdraft2020: 15]).
No info on millions.
No info on millions.
No info on millions.
example_comment: transcription needs revision. transcribing as labialized /č'ʷ/ as in [pasquereaudraft2020: 19]

comment: No info on millions.
Only after components 3, 5, and 20.
After components less than 20. Info on 100 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
example_comment: transcription needs revision. The source [177] claims that хъ is an uvular affricate. But there is no such phoneme in IPA, is there…

comment: After components less than 20. '20' qu has no marker on its own but attaches it when multiplied: q’o-no qu=no ‘40’ ([forker2013: 394] interprets this as the additive suffix). No info on millions.
After components less than 100. Info on 1 000 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
After components less than 100. Info on 100 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: кIе-л азир ‘2 000’. No info on millions.
Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: aʁ˳-al hazir ‘4 000’. Info on 100 and 1 000 is unclear, no info on higher numerals.
Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: ʁa-jal azir ‘20 000’. No info on millions.
Suffix -al is absent in cardinals (but it appears in collective numerals: ʕāˤb-al-ra ‘all three’).
No info on millions.
Only after components 2—10, 20, 100, when these components are alone. But look into: ʡɑˤb-ɑl ʔɑzir çulum ‘30 000 женщин’ [example from Magomed, through Samira Verhees]. No info on millions.
Only after components 2—10, 20, when these components are alone. But look into: ʡá̰b-al azúr ‘3 000’. No info on millions.

According to the source, only after the component '9' when it is final in complex numerals (not in '9' itself), and tens 30, 40, … 90. (However, I think in tens final -al should be interpreted as part of the root -c'al. So this applies to '9's only.)
No info on millions.
example_comment: transcription needs revision. There is no кь in the table of phonemes on page [7]. Judging by [8], there must be a typo in the table. Where кь /q'/ should be, there is another кI (row VI, column 6)

comment: No info on millions.
1' and '2' omit the marker when used attributively. '40' jaxc’ur does not bear the marker, too. Other than that, all components lower than 100 have the marker. No info on millions.
Only after components 1—10, 20. Info on whether tens 30, 50, 60, … 90 inflect by class varies in sources. No info on millions.
Only after components 2—10, 20. No info on millions.

Full form -CM-le is used only after components 1—10 and 20 when they are final or when counting millions. Just -CM is used in final positions in 11—19, 21—29, and in non-final positions in 2—10 and 20.
example_comment: It seems that the class marker here is -d initially but it undergoes assimilation before /l/ and becomes -l. About assimilation: [alekseevetal1998: 398 (in the file)]

comment: Class marker does not appear in the adnominal position (when substantivized, only after components 1—10, 20).
Class marker does not appear in the adnominal position (when substantivized, only after components 1—10, 20).
Only after components 1—10, 20 (100 is derived vigesimally, so it has the marker too). No info on millions.
Only after components 1—10, 20 (100 is derived vigesimally, so it has the marker too). No info on millions.

example_comment: uppercase D is standard notation for a class marker

comment: In the substantivized form in numerals 1, 2, 3, and 5 the glottal stop is added after the root (all of which end with vowels). Root '4' ends with the glottal stop in all positions, it is a part of the root.

example_comment: uppercase V is used to mark class
